derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French coquille 'shell', based on Greek konkhulion, from konkhē 'conch'
mid 16th cent.: from French coquiller 'blister (bread in cooking'), from coquille 'shell' (see cockle)

means.word_mean: 2. common edible European bivalve mollusk having a rounded shell with radiating ribs

2. to gather something into small wrinkles or folds;
